function_call.name: classify_risks_PESTLE
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Effect of relative humidity on uv effectiveness against bacteria and viruses","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inconsistent impact of rh on bioaerosol particle size","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of consensus on the impact of rh on bioaerosol particle size","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of viruses due to aerosolization and sampling","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Enveloped viruses like mhv coronavirus are susceptible to inactivation by mechanical stress.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Aerosolization and sampling can lead to survival of infectious viruses, increasing the risk of disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Differences in survival rates of viruses in different suspension media can impact disease transmission","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uv susceptibility of viral aerosols varies with different viruses and rh levels, affecting the effectiveness of uv-c disinfection","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Uv radiation mapping shows variability in uv exposure levels across the chamber.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Testing the effects of nebulization on the survival of viruses.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential leakage of viral aerosols due to inadequate sealing of chamber parts.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Contamination of the experimental chamber by microorganisms due to inadequate filtration or backflow prevention.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to viral aerosols during chamber maintenance and operation.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling of infectious viral samples in the laboratory","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Exposure to viral aerosols during experimental procedures","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Improper disposal of viral samples and contaminated materials","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Handling and cultivation of bacteriophage ms2 and e. coli c3000 may pose a risk of accidental exposure and infection.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on the effectiveness of uv air disinfection in preventing airborne transmission of viral aerosols such as sars coronavirus.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertain relationship between relative humidity rh and uv inactivation rate of bacterial aerosols.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Unknown uv susceptibility of pathogenic viral aerosols under varying relative humidity rh conditions.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential airborne spread of new pathogens such as sars coronavirus and influenza virus","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Limited data on uvgi inactivation of viral aerosols","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Uncertainty about the effectiveness of uvgi on different airborne microorganisms","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Use of germicidal sources in the built environment during the heating period","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential reactivation of pathogens during air transport after central disinfection","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Risk of sars-cov-2, influenza a, and legionella pneumophila transmission through indoor air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate air exchange leading to high indoor air contamination levels","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of various sources for heat and cold production may increase the risk of cross-contamination and the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Humidification of air using water vapor may create an environment conducive to the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Use of germicidal emitters or sources may lead to the production of harmful by-products or chemicals.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate humidity control in the built environment can promote the growth and spread of airborne pathogens.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient energy consumption in air conditioning operation can lead to poor indoor air quality and ventilation.","category":"Economic risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate positioning of uv tubes for germicidal sources resulting in ineffective disinfection of ventilation ducts and flowing air.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inaccurate calculation of required power input for uv tubes leading to underperformance or excessive energy consumption.","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate consideration of environmental impact in the selection of energy sources for germicidal treatment.","category":"Environmental risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of consideration for optimal performance of the uv-c fluorescent source","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate design of the uv-c system leading to high operating costs","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Insufficient consideration of indoor air parameters for different seasons","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Electrical breakdowns caused by high humidity and condensation affecting fluorescent lamps","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inefficient operation of uv-c system in the event of air flow stoppage","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence of uv-c system efficiency on air flow resistance and mechanical effects on lamps","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Shortened life cycle of fluorescent lamps due to excessive switching cycles","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Long-term operation of uv-c system without proper maintenance and regulation","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Failure to monitor uv-c system operating hours and power output","category":"Technological risks","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decreasing efficiency of uv-c system due to lamp degradation, air temperature, dust pollution, and reflective surface degradation.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Decreasing efficiency of uv-c system due to lamp degradation and environmental factors.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential exposure to uv-c radiation for maintenance personnel or occupants if not properly shielded or turned off during maintenance.","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Inadequate maintenance of uv-c system leading to reduced disinfection effectiveness.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Poorly designed uv-c system leading to uneven radiation distribution and ineffective disinfection.","category":"Infrastructure risks","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Pathogens transmitted through the air","category":"Public health risks","confidence":"High"}]}
